comment:
* Enqueues chunks of data (from various sources -- application crashes, kernel * log records, etc.). The queue is size bounded and will drop old data if the * enqueued data exceeds the maximum size. You can think of this as a * persistent, system-wide, blob-oriented "logcat". * *

DropBoxManager entries are not sent anywhere directly, but other system * services and debugging tools may scan and upload entries for processing.

variables.name: IS_EMPTY
variables.comment: Flag value: Entry's content was deleted to save space.

variables.name: IS_TEXT
variables.comment: Flag value: Content is human-readable UTF-8 text (can be combined with IS_GZIPPED).

variables.name: IS_GZIPPED
variables.comment: Flag value: Content can be decompressed with {@link java.util.zip.GZIPOutputStream}.

variables.name: HAS_BYTE_ARRAY
variables.comment: Flag value for serialization only: Value is a byte array, not a file descriptor

variables.name: ACTION_DROPBOX_ENTRY_ADDED
variables.comment:
* Broadcast Action: This is broadcast when a new entry is added in the dropbox. * You must hold the {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_LOGS} permission * in order to receive this broadcast. This broadcast can be rate limited for low priority * entries * *

This is a protected intent that can only be sent * by the system.

variables.name: EXTRA_TAG
variables.comment:
* Extra for {@link android.os.DropBoxManager#ACTION_DROPBOX_ENTRY_ADDED}:
     * string containing the dropbox tag.

variables.name: EXTRA_TIME
variables.comment:
* Extra for {@link android.os.DropBoxManager#ACTION_DROPBOX_ENTRY_ADDED}:
     * long integer value containing time (in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC)
     * when the entry was created.

variables.name: EXTRA_DROPPED_COUNT

methods.name: public void addText(String tag, String data)
methods.comment:
* Stores human-readable text.  The data may be discarded eventually (or even
     * immediately) if space is limited, or ignored entirely if the tag has been
     * blocked (see {@link #isTagEnabled}).
     *
     * @param tag describing the type of entry being stored
     * @param data value to store

methods.name: public void addData(String tag, byte[] data, int flags)
methods.comment:
* Stores binary data, which may be ignored or discarded as with {@link #addText}.
     *
     * @param tag describing the type of entry being stored
     * @param data value to store
     * @param flags describing the data

methods.name: public void addFile(String tag, File file, int flags) throws IOException
methods.comment:
* Stores the contents of a file, which may be ignored or discarded as with
     * {@link #addText}.
     *
     * @param tag describing the type of entry being stored
     * @param file to read from
     * @param flags describing the data
     * @throws IOException if the file can't be opened

methods.name: public boolean isTagEnabled(String tag)
methods.comment:
* Checks any blacklists (set in system settings) to see whether a certain
     * tag is allowed.  Entries with disabled tags will be dropped immediately,
     * so you can save the work of actually constructing and sending the data.
     *
     * @param tag that would be used in {@link #addText} or {@link #addFile}
     * @return whether events with that tag would be accepted

methods.name: public Entry getNextEntry(String tag, long msec)
methods.comment: * Gets the next entry from the drop box after the specified time. * You must always call {@link Entry#close()} on the return value! * * @param tag of entry to look for, null for all tags * @param msec time of the last entry seen * @return the next entry, or null if there are no more entries

methodNames: public void addText(String tag, String data)
public void addData(String tag, byte[] data, int flags)
public void addFile(String tag, File file, int flags) throws IOException
public Entry getNextEntry(String tag, long msec)
